intro: Ossaea acunae, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry environments. Ossaea acunae is adapted to survive in harsh, low-nutrient soils and can thrive with minimal water.
